item.description: Economy # 1.1 Participatory Economics in Utopia # Vekllei does not use money. To some extent, that statement summarises the core of the idea. Just as the abstract and mercantile economies of the United States are far removed from these shores, so too are the utopian ideas of Morris and More with all such romanticism and glory of immercantile society. The whole Vekllei system is perhaps better summed up as a thoroughly uncommodified society as opposed to a simply ‘cashless’ one; for the real material consequence of the absence of money is not in its transitory symbolism as a moneyless utopia but in how Vekllei people have come to approach domestic postindustrial life.
National Intelligence in Vekllei # Americas Bureau #
